places_to_visit.name: Buda Castle
places_to_visit.description: Buda Castle is a historic castle and palace complex that dominates the skyline of Budapest. It houses the Hungarian National Gallery and the Budapest History Museum and offers stunning views of the city.

places_to_visit.name: Fisherman’s Bastion
places_to_visit.description: Fisherman’s Bastion is a neo-Gothic terrace in the Buda Castle district, offering panoramic views of the Danube River and the city. Its fairytale-like towers are a popular photo spot.

places_to_visit.name: Parliament Building
places_to_visit.description: The Hungarian Parliament Building is an architectural masterpiece on the Danube's banks. It's known for its ornate facade, grand interior, and historical significance as the seat of Hungary's government.

places_to_visit.name: Thermal Baths
places_to_visit.description: Budapest is famous for its thermal baths, including Széchenyi Thermal Bath and Gellért Baths. These historic baths offer a relaxing experience with various pools and wellness facilities.

places_to_visit.name: St. Stephen’s Basilica
places_to_visit.description: St. Stephen’s Basilica is a magnificent church named after Hungary's first king. It features stunning architecture, an impressive dome, and offers panoramic views from its observation deck.
